chargeHist.descr: Theft from a Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sherri L Curzi in court.  Attorney John E. German in court for Sherri L Curzi.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:46 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 3rd status. Record by Atty. German as to status. He needs to meet with Atty. Berg. Court goes off the record to have attorneys make appointment now. Back on the record - Court sets for final status.
Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
NSF letter mailed to DE

Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherri L Curzi in court.  Attorney John E. German in court for Sherri L Curzi. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Offer received. Parties are negotiating. Asking for STC in 60 days. Defendant has $1,000 today to pay toward restitution. Case to be re-assigned. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherri L Curzi in court.  Attorney John E. German in court for Sherri L Curzi. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Discovery not yet obtained. Offer received. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

records.addlTxt:
2:11 PM Defendant Sherri L Curzi in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court.  Attorney John E. German in court for Sherri L Curzi. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney German acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty on behalf of his client.
adj. 2:13
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH FIRST CITIZEN STATE BANK. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
